episodes.description: A new crew is assigned to a former Cardassian space station: Deep Space Nine. It is a joint Federation/Bajoran force, with Commander Sisko in charge, but his life is dramatically changed when he is declared the Emissary to the Prophets by a Bajoran priest.
episodes.title: Emissary (1)

episodes.description: A new crew is assigned to a former Cardassian space station: Deep Space Nine. It is a joint Federation/Bajoran force, with Commander Sisko in charge, but his life is dramatically changed when he is declared the Emissary to the Prophets by a Bajoran priest.
episodes.title: Emissary (2)

episodes.description: Tahna Los, a former Bajoran terrorist during the Occupation, asks Sisko for asylum on DS9. Meanwhile, the station's last Cardassian inhabitant, Garak, possibly a former spy for the Cardassian government, proves an interesting mystery to Dr. Bashir.
episodes.title: Past Prologue

episodes.description: Ibudan, a criminal/murderer Odo has dealt with before, returns to DS9 only to be murdered shortly after. . .leaving Odo to be the prime suspect. Meanwhile, Jake and Nog's trouble making prompt Keiko to do something helpful for the station's children.
episodes.title: A Man Alone

episodes.description: The crew and civilian population of Deep Space Nine begin to gabble when a plague, engineered by the Bajorans as a weapon against the Cardassians, accidentally gets released into the station's atmosphere.
episodes.title: Babel

episodes.description: For the first time an alien comes from the other side of the wormhole. He has ship trouble and seems very reluctant to accept any help. Chief O'Brien quickly finds out he has a secret.

podcasts.episode: Puts the Chew on the Other Ass
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Captive Pursuit

episodes.description: Q, the Enterprise-D's consistent omnipotent annoyance, comes to harass the DS9 crew when his traveling companion, Vash, refuses to travel with Q any longer.
episodes.title: Q-Less

episodes.description: Sins of the Host indeed, as Jadzia Dax is accused of a murder her previous host, Curzon, supposedly committed.
episodes.title: Dax

episodes.description: Rao Vantika, a captured criminal, is badly burned and dies in Bashir's arms. . .but the criminal's captor believes he is still alive.
episodes.title: The Passenger

episodes.description: The Wadi from the Gamma Quadrant are to make first contact and decide to visit DS9. When they catch Quark cheating they let him off by playing a special game.
episodes.title: Move Along Home

episodes.description: The Ferengi's greatest politician and leader, the Grand Nagus, comes to the station. He seems very interested in Quark's bar.
episodes.title: The Nagus

episodes.description: A man named Croden tells Odo he can take him to a place where aliens much like Odo himself exist, which would help Odo find out where he truly comes from.
episodes.title: Vortex

episodes.description: After showing Bajoran spiritual leader Kai Opaka the wormhole, she, Sisko, Bashir and Kira crash land on a moon. Kai Opaka dies and the three meet the unfriendly locals.

podcasts.episode: A Box that Does the Work
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Battle Lines

episodes.description: While Sisko tries to negotiate an agreement between two Bajoran factions, he orders O'Brien to escort Bashir to an emergency that endangers a village.
episodes.title: The Storyteller

episodes.description: Kira must convince an old Bajoran farmer to leave a moon becoming uninhabitable due to mining operations. Jake and Nog try to trade off Cardassian yamok sauce.
episodes.title: Progress

episodes.description: Dax investigates if an unusual energy reading is dangerous for the station when all of the sudden people's imaginations really come alive, causing chaos.
episodes.title: If Wishes Were Horses

episodes.description: Lwaxana Troi comes for a political visit and instead hounds Odo for romantic attention. Meanwhile, an alien probe wrecks havoc with the station's computer, leaving Odo and Lwaxana trapped together.
episodes.title: The Forsaken

episodes.description: Out of nowhere the entire station's command staff, save Odo, become power hungry and vie to defeat each other by forming secret alliances and plotting assassinations. Needless to say, Odo tries to figure out how this mysterious behavior was influenced.
episodes.title: Dramatis Personae

episodes.description: A Cardassian suffering from Kalla-Nohra, a disease that indicates he served in a labor camp, visits DS9. Kira is determined to convict him as a war criminal.
episodes.title: Duet

episodes.description: Vedek Winn, a candidate in the race for the open Kai position, stirs up trouble on DS9 when she attempts to boycott Keiko's school for not teaching Bajoran religious beliefs.
episodes.title: In the Hands of the Prophets

episodes.description: Word that a previously thought dead Bajoran resistance legend is still alive sends Kira and Chief O'Brien to Cardassia IV to rescue him; meanwhile "The Circle", a sect of the Bajoran provisional government that is intent on wiping out alien influence, is sneaking into power.
episodes.title: The Homecoming

episodes.description: Kira spends time with Vedek Bareil on Bajor just as "The Circle" begins arming themselves from a mysterious source.

podcasts.episode: A Lotion for Everything and Everything in its Lotion
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: The Circle

episodes.description: As a "Circle"-led Bajoran military tries to occupy the station, a skeleton crew led by Sisko fight to reveal "The Circle's" big secret before they are forced to evacuate themselves. Meanwhile, Kira and Dax lead a mission to reveal the truth about "The Circle" on Bajor.
episodes.title: The Siege

episodes.description: A jealous Trill, who had waited his entire life to receive a symbiont but never had, decides to steal one. . .Dax's!

podcasts.episode: We Get Worse in Both Directions
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Invasive Procedures

episodes.description: Political heat rises on the station as Bajorans enter the station with orphaned Cardassians they have adopted.
episodes.title: Cardassians

episodes.description: A new arrival to the station with a special gravity-based disability appeals to Bashir's heart; meanwhile an old associate of Quark's comes to the station to kill the barkeep.
episodes.title: Melora

episodes.description: A female Ferengi, posing as a male to be available to participate in business (a rule STRICTLY forbidden by the Ferengi government), falls for Quark during very important negotiations between the Ferengi and a Gamma Quadrant race.
episodes.title: Rules of Acquisition

episodes.description: Odo relives some terrible and tragic memories of a past investigation when he was the constable on Cardassian-occupied Deep Space Nine, then named Terok Nor.
episodes.title: Necessary Evil

episodes.description: While noted scientist Gideon Seyetik is preparing for an ambitious project, re-igniting a star, Sisko is intrigued by a woman who keeps disappearing.
episodes.title: Second Sight

episodes.description: A race that has been conquered twice over, one of the conquerors being the mysterious Dominion, comes to the station seeking aid and a new home.

podcasts.episode: One Horn Player Does Not Make an Artist Community
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Sanctuary

episodes.description: Quark meets his match when a new rival opens a casino opposite Quark's Bar on the Promenade; meanwhile the station is suffering issues of high improbability.
episodes.title: Rivals

episodes.description: Odo and Dr. Mora Pol, Odo's 'father', discover a life form similar to Odo on a Gamma Quadrant planet.

podcasts.episode: We're Really Luxuriating in this Maron
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: The Alternate

episodes.description: Chief O'Brien, who still doesn't like the good Doctor Bashir, must rely on him when the two are stranded on a planet and O'Brien is infected with a deadly, fast moving disease.

podcasts.episode: Apropos of Nothing (But Sort of What We Were Talking About)
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Armageddon Game

episodes.description: Chief O'Brien's world is turned upside down when for no reason whatsoever he is being ignored by his family and friends and is being closed out of every essential job on the station.
episodes.title: Whispers

episodes.description: Sisko and Chief O'Brien discover a colony that lives without technology.
episodes.title: Paradise

episodes.description: Odo and Dax investigate the mysterious disappearance of people from a village. Kira tries to keep a close eye on Quark, while Vedek Bareil unexpectedly visits.

podcasts.episode: A Real Haranguing or Banging Conundrum
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Shadowplay

episodes.description: A Trill named Arjin comes to DS9 to learn what it is to be a Trill with a symbiont but finds his teacher, Dax, to be less than he expected.
episodes.title: Playing God

episodes.description: A Cardassian woman, who was once a former flame of Quark's, visits the station under dubious circumstances.

podcasts.episode: The Sooner We End This Episode The Sooner I Can Stop Looking At You
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Profit and Loss

episodes.description: Three legendary Klingons come to DS9 to see if Jadzia Dax will participate in a Blood Oath they made with Jadzia's previous host Curzon.
episodes.title: Blood Oath

episodes.description: The destruction of a Cardassian ship leads Sisko, Dukat, and Sisko's old friend Cal Hudson to the fact that there is an unofficial war between the Maquis and the Cardassians.
episodes.title: The Maquis (1)

episodes.description: Sisko tries to resolve the Maquis crisis by preventing a war, freeing Gul Dukat and offering the defected Hudson the chance to return.
episodes.title: The Maquis (2)

episodes.description: Dr. Bashir fights to save Garak's life when a device implanted in his brain, designed to alleviate pain in the event of torture, begins to malfunction and is slowly killing him.
episodes.title: The Wire

episodes.description: Kira and Bashir find themselves in an alternate universe.
episodes.title: Crossover

episodes.description: Vedek Bareil is targeted by fellow Kai candidate Vedek Winn as having been a collaborator with the Cardassians during the Occupation.
episodes.title: The Collaborator

episodes.description: Chief O'Brien goes through the horrific Cardassian judicial system when he is charged for an unknown crime.
episodes.title: Tribunal

episodes.description: Sisko and Quark and a strange telepathic woman are arrested by Jem'Hadar, soldiers of the Dominion.

podcasts.episode: It's Like Her Hair is a Cookie
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: The Jem'Hadar

episodes.description: Instead of waiting for the Jem'Hadar to attack, Sisko wants to try a different approach. He wants to take a new class starship to try to find the Founders.
episodes.title: The Search (1)

episodes.description: Odo has found his home and is introduced. Meanwhile Sisko finds out peace talks between the Dominion and the Federation have already started.
episodes.title: The Search (2)

episodes.description: Quark is forced to marry a Klingon widow after he takes credit for the accidental death of her husband, the head of a powerful Klingon House.
episodes.title: The House of Quark

episodes.description: The Trill homeworld is the setting, as Sisko and Bashir take Jadzia home for treatment when she begins experiencing hallucinations after playing a tune she can't recall.

podcasts.episode: Be The Industrial Mixer You Want To See In The World
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Equilibrium

episodes.description: Kira finds herself on Cardassia as a Cardassian. She is told she is called Iliana Ghemor and was a Cardassian spy.

podcasts.episode: She Puts the Beige in Bajor
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Second Skin

episodes.description: Odo tries to change the nature of a Jem'Hadar boy that Quark finds, while Sisko tries to break his son's relationship with a 20 year old Dabo girl.

podcasts.episode: You Can Kill Them With Embarrassment
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: The Abandoned

episodes.description: The station goes into lockdown and the crew is endangered when an old Cardassian security program is accidentally activated.
episodes.title: Civil Defense

episodes.description: Dax falls in love with one of the residents of a multi-dimensional planet, while on DS9 an alien requests a holosuite program of Kira from Quark.
episodes.title: Meridian

episodes.description: Thomas Riker, impersonating Will Riker, steals the Defiant in order to fight with the Maquis. Sisko assist Gul Dukat on Cardassia Prime in stopping the ship entering Cardassian territory.
episodes.title: Defiant

episodes.description: As Lwaxanna Troi visits the station for a Bajoran festival, the crew is stricken with intense romantic attractions to one another.

podcasts.episode: No Atheists in a Bajor Hole
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Fascination

episodes.description: Sisko, Bashir and Dax are accidentally sent to San Francisco in the 21st century due to a transporter malfunction, and must figure out how to get back to return without changing the time line.

podcasts.episode: They Found Him in Berkeley, They Left Him in Berkeley
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Past Tense (1)

episodes.description: Sisko is forced to take the place of a key historical figure on Earth in 2024 in order to preserve the timeline.
episodes.title: Past Tense (2)

episodes.description: Dr. Bashir must use extraordinary measures to prolong Vedek Bareil's life long enough to allow Bareil to complete sensitive peace negotiations between the Bajorans and the Cardassians.
episodes.title: Life Support

episodes.description: After chasing a fugitive into a cave, Kira gets stuck and is slowly encapsulated by a growing crystal stone while Odo tries to figure out how to free her.
episodes.title: Heart of Stone

episodes.description: Sisko faces a conflict between his Starfleet duties and his role as the Bajoran Emissary when an ancient Bajoran prophecy predicts that a joint Federation-Cardassian project will lead to the destruction of the wormhole.
episodes.title: Destiny

episodes.description: Grand Nagus Zek is acting bizarre by giving away money and rewriting the Rules of Acquisition. Quark attempts to get the old Nagus back.
episodes.title: Prophet Motive

episodes.description: While a Romulan delegation tries to get information about the Dominion, O'Brien gets visions of unpleasant things that are about to happen in the future.
episodes.title: Visionary

episodes.description: After being attacked in the infirmary, Dr. Bashir has a dual mystery on his hands: what has happened to the station while he was out and why is he aging so rapidly now?
episodes.title: Distant Voices

episodes.description: Sisko is kidnapped to impersonate his deceased, mirror universe self to gain Jennifer Sisko's loyalty in the Rebel Alliance.
episodes.title: Through the Looking Glass

episodes.description: After an attempt is made on Garak's life, Odo conducts the investigation on who tried to murder the Cardassian tailor - and why.

podcasts.episode: You Went A to F U
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Improbable Cause

episodes.description: Now rejoined with his former mentor, Garak is ordered to interrogate Odo about the secrets of his people, while the joined Romulan/Cardassian attack fleet moves towards the Founders' home world on a mission of destruction.

podcasts.episode: Ask the Husnock (If You Can Find Any)
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: The Die Is Cast

episodes.description: Sisko rebuilds an ancient Bajoran space vessel from the blueprints, and he and Jake take the ship on a trip, attempting to prove that the ancient Bajorans went beyond their solar system without warp drive.
episodes.title: Explorers

episodes.description: Quark and Rom return to the Ferengi home world because their mother has broken the law - by wearing clothes and earning profits, forbidden for women in Ferengi society.
episodes.title: Family Business

episodes.description: News arrives that Kai Winn has also become Bajor's political leader. She asks Kira to negotiate with an old resistance friend about returning soil reclamators.
episodes.title: Shakaar

episodes.description: Dax asks the crew to join her Zhian'tara ritual. The memories of her former hosts will take over their bodies. Nog is preparing for Starfleet Academy.
episodes.title: Facets

episodes.description: The Defiant is off to show the Federation's presence to the new Tzenkethi government. While underway the ship malfunctions and Bashir is suspected of sabotage.
episodes.title: The Adversary

episodes.description: Sisko becomes uncomfortable when the Klingons station a task force to help defend against the Dominion. Worf is summoned to find out their true intentions.
episodes.title: The Way of the Warrior (1)

episodes.description: Sisko becomes uncomfortable when the Klingons station a task force to help defend against the Dominion. Worf is summoned to find out their true intentions.
episodes.title: The Way of the Warrior (2)

episodes.description: Melanie, an aspiring writer, wants to know why Jake Sisko stopped writing at 40. Jake tells how his father died in an accident and then suddenly reappeared.
episodes.title: The Visitor

episodes.description: Bashir is asked to help a group of renegade Jem'Hadar break their addiction to ketracel white. Meanwhile Worf is dissatisfied with the way Odo runs security.
episodes.title: Hippocratic Oath

episodes.description: Kira and Gul Dukat go after the lost prison ship Ravinok. Dukat has a secret. Meanwhile Kasidy Yates tries to find work near Bajor, leaving Sisko uncomfortable.
episodes.title: Indiscretion

episodes.description: Lenara Kahn, the new host of the wife of Dax's former host Torias, comes to the station. While they're not allowed to renew their relation, there's still a spark.
episodes.title: Rejoined

episodes.description: A damaged Defiant must play a dangerous game of cat-and-mouse with two Jem'hadar ships inside a gas giant.

podcasts.episode: They Really Spent on the Sparks
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Starship Down

episodes.description: Quark and Rom take Nog to Earth and Starfleet Academy, but a malfunction with the ship takes the crew back in time, to Roswell New Mexico in 1947.
episodes.title: Little Green Men

episodes.description: Worf, Dax and the Klingon Dahar master Kor set out to find an ancient lost relic: the Sword of Kahless.
episodes.title: The Sword of Kahless

episodes.description: When an transporter emergency turns the command crew into holosuite characters, Bashir's James Bond fantasy takes on a deadly reality.

podcasts.episode: Hoofs in the High Stakes Area
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Our Man Bashir

episodes.description: Sisko travels to Earth when a bombing at a Federation conference is determined to be the work of Changelings.
episodes.title: Homefront

episodes.description: When Starfleet institutes martial law to combat the Changeling Menace, Sisko begins to question if the Dominion is the real threat.
episodes.title: Paradise Lost

episodes.description: First Minister Shakaar visits the station, despite a threat of assassination. He falls in love with Kira much to Odo's dismay.
episodes.title: Crossfire

episodes.description: Dukat returns, stripped of his prestige, to escort Kira to a Cardassian conference about the Dominion. But an attack by a Klingon raider may give Dukat a chance to redeem himself in the eyes of his government.
episodes.title: Return to Grace

episodes.description: Worf's brother Kurn asks him to perform a death rite to regain his lost honor. Meanwhile Kira and O'Brien investigate Klingon activity near the Bajoran border.
episodes.title: Sons of Mogh

episodes.description: Unfair working conditions and pay cuts cause Rom to organize a union of the employees of Quark's Bar. Meanwhile Worf still finds it hard to settle on the station.
episodes.title: Bar Association

episodes.description: A man claiming to be the emissary comes through the wormhole. Sisko is happy to give up his position. Meanwhile Keiko returns and O'Brien stops spending time with Bashir.
episodes.title: Accession

episodes.description: When Worf destroys a civilian shuttle during an engagement with the Klingons, an extradition hearing is held to see if he must face charges.
episodes.title: Rules of Engagement

episodes.description: O'Brien tries to re-integrate to life on the station after serving 20 years in a virtual prison.
episodes.title: Hard Time

episodes.description: When the Mirror Universe counterpart of Sisko's deceased wife lures Jake to the other side, Sisko must follow and help the human resistance against the Alliance's forces.

podcasts.episode: I Am Not Your Mom (I Am “Malibu” Your Mom)
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Shattered Mirror

episodes.description: A mysterious woman approaches Jake about his future as a writer. Odo promises to do whatever it takes to help Lwaxana Troi keep her baby over the father's wishes - even if it means marrying her himself.
episodes.title: The Muse

episodes.description: Sisko must face betrayal when evidence surfaces that Kasidy is smuggling for the Maquis. Meanwhile Garak makes acquaintance with Ziyal.

podcasts.episode: Hard to Hide a Gun in a Bathrobe
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: For the Cause

episodes.description: A renegade group of Jem'Hadar plunders Deep Space Nine. Sisko agrees to a combat operation with loyal Jem'Hadar to prevent the renegades completing a planetary gateway.

podcasts.episode: Measure Twice, See if You’re Cut Once
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: To the Death

episodes.description: Bashir tries to help a planet in the grips of a Dominion-engineered plague that guarantees a painful death.
episodes.title: The Quickening

episodes.description: Quarks hears on Ferenginar he is going to die. Rom convinces him to sell his remains. After an accident, Bashir has to move Keiko's baby to Kira's womb.

podcasts.episode: Until Your Face is as Blue as Your Shirt
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Body Parts

episodes.description: Odo is suddenly struck by illness. He is barely able to hold shape. Bashir and Odo see no other alternative then going to the Founders. Garak wants to come along.
episodes.title: Broken Link

episodes.description: With the war between Klingons and Federation intensifying, Sisko must make a plan to expose Gowron as a changeling. Odo is still having trouble with becoming a solid.
episodes.title: Apocalypse Rising

episodes.description: The crew is forced to retreat in a crashed Jem'Hadar ship after an attack by the Jem'Hadar. They get the feeling there's something very important about this ship.
episodes.title: The Ship

episodes.description: While Worf helps Quark to pursue his former wife Grilka, O'Brien and Kira grow uncomfortably close to each other.

podcasts.episode: Up Your Worf and Around the Corner
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Looking for par'Mach in All the Wrong Places

episodes.description: Jake, reporting from the front lines, sees what war truly is.
episodes.title: Nor the Battle to the Strong

episodes.description: An alien entity has possessed Keiko's body and is holding it hostage until O'Brien completes an assignment for it.
episodes.title: The Assignment

episodes.description: Darvin, a disgraced Klingon spy, travels back in time to alter some events to his likings. The DS9 crew must find what he's trying to change and prevent it without altering the time line. They'll have to blend in with the crew from Star Trek: The Original Series.

podcasts.episode: When You Do Time Crime, You Have To Do The Time Crime Time
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Trials and Tribble-ations

episodes.description: While vacationing on Risa, Worf and Dax meet a group of fundamentalist protesters who claim that the Federation has gone soft.
episodes.title: Let He Who Is Without Sin...

episodes.description: Sisko, Dax, Odo and Garak find themselves in the past when the Cardassians controlled the station, and a crime that Odo investigated may be the key.
episodes.title: Things Past

episodes.description: When Odo and Quark crash land, they must put aside their differences to climb a mountain to signal for help. Jake and Nog try to be roommates, but their different styles clash.
episodes.title: The Ascent

episodes.description: Sisko begins having visions that may show him how to best help Bajor, but they're killing him.
episodes.title: Rapture

episodes.description: A mysterious assassin begins wiping out all the members of Kira's old resistance cell.

podcasts.episode: Once a Vigilante, Always a Vigilante
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: The Darkness and the Light

episodes.description: The discovery of an infant Changeling gives Odo a chance to correct what he sees as the "mistakes" in his upbringing. But as Starfleet's pressure for results grows, he has to turn to his "father," Dr. Mora
episodes.title: The Begotten

episodes.description: When the traitorous Eddington returns, Sisko will go to any lengths to capture him.
episodes.title: For the Uniform

episodes.description: A coded message from the Gamma Quadrant leads Garak to believe his mentor, Enabran Tain, is still alive. He and Worf seek him out, only to discover something much worse: a Dominion invasion fleet poised to attack the Alpha Quadrant.
episodes.title: In Purgatory's Shadow (1)

episodes.description: The station readies for a Dominion attack. Worf and Garak meet some unexpected friends in a Dominion Prison camp.
episodes.title: By Inferno's Light (2)

episodes.description: Dr. Bashir is selected to be the model for the next-generation of Emergency Medical Hologram (EMH). But he balks when his parents are invited to the station to be interviewed by the EMH programmer, Dr. Zimmerman. There is a dark secret in his family that he's afraid that his parents will reveal.
episodes.title: Doctor Bashir, I Presume?

episodes.description: Odo becomes romantically attached to a woman working with the Orion Syndicate.
episodes.title: A Simple Investigation

episodes.description: Quark must wrestle with his conscience when he becomes involved with arms merchants.
episodes.title: Business as Usual

episodes.description: When a Cardassian official that thinks of Kira as his daughter is dying, he agrees to reveal all he knows to her. But the experience dredges up Kira's memories of her own father's death.

podcasts.episode: You Can’t be a Legate in Tweed
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Ties of Blood and Water

episodes.description: Quark doesn't know whether to be panicked or overjoyed when he learns that his mother is the new lover of the Grand Nagus.
episodes.title: Ferengi Love Songs

episodes.description: Dax and Worf accompany Martok on his first command since being held by the Dominion. But the ship they are given hasn't seen victory in months and the crew is near mutinous.
episodes.title: Soldiers of the Empire

episodes.description: The DS9 cast discovers a small colony on a remote world that was originally populated by them 200 years earlier due to a time-travel accident with the Defiant. The current colonists lives depend on making sure that accident happens again, even though they've now forwarned the crew that it will happen. Each crew member needs to decide if they are willing to give up their lives on DS9 in order to preserve the history of the colony.
episodes.title: Children of Time

episodes.description: Driven to desperation by the Dominion, the Maquis launch a massive bio-weapons strike towards Cardassia. Sisko must trust the traitor Eddington to try to stop them.
episodes.title: Blaze of Glory

episodes.description: While salvaging components from DS9's sister station, the crew run afoul of a "surprise" left behind by the Cardassians.

podcasts.episode: It’s Always Your Birthday at the Klingon Restaurant
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Empok Nor

episodes.description: Jake and Nog go through hell and high water, from participating in an auction to dealing with the Dominion, to receiving a Willie Mays baseball card to cheer up the war-fatigued Captain Sisko.
episodes.title: In the Cards

episodes.description: With the continuing battalions of Jem'Hadar entering the Alpha Quadrant in preparation for war, Sisko decides to mine the wormhole to prevent further troop movement. This provokes a confrontation between the Dominion and the Federation, forcing Sisko to abandon DS9.
episodes.title: Call to Arms

episodes.description: Borrowing a captured Jem'Hadar attack ship, Sisko and crew embark on a mission to destroy the hidden base where all of the ketracel-white is stored for the entire Alpha Quadrant.
episodes.title: A Time to Stand

episodes.description: Sisko and his crew crash on a barren world when their commandeered Jem'Hadar ship is shot down. They encounter Jem'Hadar who crashed there earlier, and have taken Nog and Garak hostage in exchange for medical aid for their Vorta overseer.
episodes.title: Rocks and Shoals

episodes.description: Serving with his recruit son aboard a Klingon vessel, Worf finds his relationship with his son strained. Meanwhile, strained relationships abound on DS9 between Major Kira and Gul Dukat.
episodes.title: Sons and Daughters

episodes.description: After forming an attack plan on the Dominion, Sisko relinquishes command of the Defiant to Dax after accepting a promotion. On DS9, the resistance faces discovery when Odo links with another changeling.
episodes.title: Behind the Lines

episodes.description: Sisko mounts an attack to re-take DS9, while Rom faces charges as an enemy of the Dominion state.
episodes.title: Favor the Bold

episodes.description: The Federation attacks DS9 in hopes of keeping the mine field in the wormhole intact, while the Dominion waits entrance to the Alpha Quadrant from the other side.

podcasts.episode: Are You There Prophets? It’s me, The Sisko
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Sacrifice of Angels

episodes.description: Suddenly desiring to wed within the week on DS9, Worf and Jadzia go through their own Klingon rituals: Worf on a four day bachelor party with the male members of the crew & Jadzia deals with her prospective mother-in-law, who totally opposes the idea of "an alien" marrying into her Klingon household.
episodes.title: You Are Cordially Invited

episodes.description: Major Kira takes a romantic interest in a Bajoran radical from the other universe who transports himself into her universe and onto DS9.
episodes.title: Resurrection

episodes.description: A group of genetically engineered humans are brought to Dr. Bashir on DS9 in hopes of integrating them with the rest of the universe.
episodes.title: Statistical Probabilities

episodes.description: At the request of the Grand Nagus, Quark puts together a mission to rescue Quark's mother, who is in the hands of the Dominion.
episodes.title: The Magnificent Ferengi

episodes.description: After being attacked by Cardassian forces, Sisko gets stranded with a very psychotic Gul Dukat, who was being transported to his trial. Meanwhile the crew of the Defiant races to rescue survivors.
episodes.title: Waltz

episodes.description: A former patron of Quark's bequeaths everything to him.
episodes.title: Who Mourns for Morn?

episodes.description: Captain Sisko has a full sensory vision of himself as an under-appreciated science fiction magazine writer in 1950s America.

podcasts.episode: The Littler The Fruit, The Sweeter The Juice
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Far Beyond the Stars

episodes.description: An attack by the Dominion on Sisko's ship endangers Dax and her crew aboard as she leads them into an anomaly that shrinks them to a very minute size. Unfortunately, they were being held stable by Sisko within a tractor beam, which was discontinued during the attack.

podcasts.episode: Ennui About Un-Wee or Worf Poem Blueballs
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: One Little Ship

episodes.description: Chief O'Brien goes undercover to infiltrate an Orion crime ring.

podcasts.episode: R U Trying to Talk Kanar RE: Damar 2 Me?
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Honor Among Thieves

episodes.description: Worf and Jadzia travel to the badlands to procure some information on the Dominion from a traitorous Cardassian. Bashir wants to engage in a holo-suite spy simulation, but O'Brien prefers to brush up on his tongo game after watching Jadzia lose to Quark.
episodes.title: Change of Heart

episodes.description: After receiving some disturbing information for Gul Dukat, Major Kira seeks Sisko's approval as Emissary to travel back in time to find out the truth about her mother. Meanwhile, Chief O'Brien and Dr. Bashir discuss a holosuite program surrounding the Battle of the Alamo.
episodes.title: Wrongs Darker Than Death or Night

episodes.description: Dr. Bashir's plans to attend a medical conference at a breezy resort are canceled when Starfleet Intelligence boards DS9, suspecting the doctor of treason.
episodes.title: Inquisition

episodes.description: To save the Federation in a critical scheme, Sisko comes to realize that he must violate its fundamental principles to do so.
episodes.title: In the Pale Moonlight

episodes.description: Odo is schooled in the ways of romance by a holographic programmed lounge singer.

podcasts.episode: Nodding on the One and the Three
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: His Way

episodes.description: Sisko runs afoul of Kai Winn when he removes a Bajoran artifact from an archaeological dig after he receives a vision from the Prophets.
episodes.title: The Reckoning

episodes.description: Jake and Nog's runabout comes under attack from the Jem'Hadar. They are rescued by the Valiant, a ship manned by Red Squad, a elite group of young Starfleet cadets.

podcasts.episode: There’s No Uhuras in Red Squad
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Valiant

episodes.description: Quark's mother and the Grand Nagus show up on DS9, announcing a new amendment to the Bill of Opportunities he has instituted on the home planet of Ferenganar, and then follows up with the announcement, that, due to the new amendment, chaos has followed and he has been deposed.
episodes.title: Profit and Lace

episodes.description: The Chief's daughter gets caught in a time displacement and when they get her back, she is considerably older.
episodes.title: Time's Orphan

episodes.description: As the Defiant races to a shipwrecked officer who is days away, the crew keeps in contact with her. Meanwhile, Jake follows Quark's latest scheme for story research.
episodes.title: The Sound of Her Voice

episodes.description: When Sisko is picked to head up an attack on the Cardassian homeworld, the Prophets appear to him in a vision, warning him of impending doom if he leaves the station.

podcasts.episode: The Brown Eye to Cardassia Prime
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Tears of the Prophets

episodes.description: Having returned to Earth a couple of months ago, Sisko waits for the Prophets to instruct him on what to do next. When he receives one, he begins searching for the woman behind the face in the sand in his vision. Meanwhile, back on DS9, Kira deals with a promotion and handling the decisions surrounding her command, and finding herself wishing for the return of Sisko. And Worf deals with the loss of his wife, Jadzia Dax.
episodes.title: Image in the Sand

episodes.description: Ezri joins Sisko and his family on his quest for the Orb of the Emissary. Colonel Kira mounts a blockade around a Bajoran moon where the Romulan alliance has deposited an ammunitions dump, claiming it in the name of defense for a Romulan hospital. And Quark joins the rest of the DS9 crew as they join Worf aboard a Klingon warship as they mount a dangerous mission in Jadzia Dax's name in an effort to get her spirit into Stovokohr, the Klingon equivalent of Heaven.
episodes.title: Shadows and Symbols

episodes.description: Sisko tries to convince Ezri to stay in Starfleet and serve aboard DS9, as Ezri tries to get to know Jadzia's friends aboard the station, especially Worf. Meanwhile, Garak tries to deal with a severe bout of claustrophobia.
episodes.title: Afterimage

episodes.description: A Vulcan captain challenges Sisko to a game of baseball.
episodes.title: Take Me Out to the Holosuite

episodes.description: Dr. Bashir attempts to bring one of his genetically engineered friends out of the catatonic state she is in, and when he is successful, he begins to fall for her.
episodes.title: Chrysalis

episodes.description: A Vorta offers Odo valuable information on the Dominion in exchange for asylum. Meanwhile, Nog tries his Ferengi knowledge as he wheels and deals for a valuable piece of equipment for Chief O'Brien.
episodes.title: Treachery, Faith, and the Great River

episodes.description: An aged Kor requests an opportunity to die with honor as a warrior.
episodes.title: Once More Unto the Breach

episodes.description: Capt. Sisko and his away team volunteer to stay with a besieged unit at an isolate outpost.

podcasts.episode: The Klingon Jukebox Doesn’t Take Quarters
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: The Siege of AR-558

episodes.description: Kira is kidnapped and taken to Empok Nor by a member of a Pah'Wraith cult and discovers the group leader is Gul Dukat.
episodes.title: Covenant

episodes.description: Severely depressed at his serious war wound, Nog retreats into Vic Fontaine's holosuite program while the singer tries to help him.
episodes.title: It's Only a Paper Moon

episodes.description: Ezri travels to her family home in search of Chief O'Brien who has discovered a murdered woman connected with the family and the Orion Syndicate.
episodes.title: Prodigal Daughter

episodes.description: Quark and Rom have to rescue Grand Nagus Zek who is being held captive in the Alternate Universe.
episodes.title: The Emperor's New Cloak

episodes.description: Find an apparently untraceable murderer, Ezri Dax reluctantly calls up the residual consciousness remnant of her symbiont's past hidden psychopathic murderer host, Joran.
episodes.title: Field of Fire

episodes.description: After searching out and finding Odo, another changeling asks him to leave DS9 with him, even though the rest of the crew aren't convinced the new changeling is not part of the Founders.
episodes.title: Chimera

episodes.description: When a programming glitch won't go away, mobsters take over Vic's and open for business, but the DS9 gang takes it personal when their favorite hangout is no longer their favorite, and they plan to get the new management ousted.
episodes.title: Badda-Bing, Badda-Bang

episodes.description: While making plans to attend a medical conference on the Romulan home world, Dr. Bashir is contacted by Sloane of Section 31 and recruited to determine the health of a high-ranking Romulan official. Things turn more desperate, though, when the ranking Starfleet admiral traveling with him, who knows about Section 31's interest in the conference mysteriously suffers a brain aneurysm after Dr. Bashir finds out that Sloane is traveling with the group, as well.
episodes.title: Inter Arma Enim Silent Leges

episodes.description: When the ship Worf was serving on is attacked in battle and all search efforts are abandoned, Ezri takes a runabout in search of him against Sisko's orders. Meanwhile, Sisko proposes to Cassidy Yates.
episodes.title: Penumbra

episodes.description: The Prophets have told Sisko that they do not agree with his impending marriage. Ezri and Worf are captured by Dominion forces. Some of the Cardassians are beginning to regret their alliance with the Dominion, as Gul Dukat, disguised as a Bajoran, sets foot on DS9.
episodes.title: 'Til Death Do Us Part

episodes.description: Kai Winn gets unknowingly involved with Gul Dukat, disguised as a Bajoran. Tensions further escalate between Weyoun and Gul Damar as the Dominion gather to sign a peace treaty with the Breen, including certain concessions of unknown territories by the Cardassians, as Ezri and Worf try to escape the Cardassian home world.

podcasts.episode: A Pod that will Live in Infamy
podcasts.title: The Greatest Generation

episodes.title: Strange Bedfellows

episodes.description: After the Breen attack Earth, mixed emotions abound on DS9. Having revealed her secret regarding the Prophets to Dukat, Kai Winn turns her back on them, only to be convinced by Dukat to embrace the Pah Wraiths. And on the home world of Cardassia, Legate Damar mounts a resistance to the Dominion.
episodes.title: The Changing Face of Evil

episodes.description: Kira gets sent behind Cardassian lines in an effort to train them in resistance fighting. When Dr. Bashir learns of the deadly disease that Odo is infected with, he gets met with barriers when trying to obtain his medical records from Starfleet. And Martok gets blindsided by Gowron when he arrives on DS9, announcing that he has assumed command of the Klingon fleet.
episodes.title: When It Rains...

episodes.description: Odo is affected by the disease threatening to eliminate his race more than he lets on to, while Kira has to deal with the Cardassian's dislike of her. Even though General Martok sees Chancellor Gowron's move as part of a political vendetta, he does nothing about it.
episodes.title: Tacking Into the Wind

episodes.description: Dr. Bashir and Chief O'Brien go to some pretty extreme measures to try and track down a cure for Odo.
episodes.title: Extreme Measures

episodes.description: Odo begins recovery from the deadly disease as Dr. Bashir informs him of Section 31's intentions of wiping out his race. A resistance mission goes bad for Kira and Garak and they end up hiding in the basement of the house that Garak grew up in, as they learned that Legate Damar becomes a casualty of war, who is also hiding with them. And the Grand Nagus chooses Quark as his successor upon his impending retirement to Reysa.
episodes.title: The Dogs of War

episodes.description: Sisko leads, what he hopes will be, a final all-out assault on Cardassia Prime, as Kira and Garak mount a suicide assault on the Cardassian headquarters, occupied by the Dominion, who kill innocent women and children village by village in retaliation for Resistance attacks.
episodes.title: What You Leave Behind (1)

episodes.description: Sisko leads, what he hopes will be, a final all-out assault on Cardassia Prime, as Kira and Garak mount a suicide assault on the Cardassian headquarters, occupied by the Dominion, who kill innocent women and children village by village in retaliation for Resistance attacks.
episodes.title: What You Leave Behind (2)
